website_summaries.verdict: An award-winning math card game that can be played 16 different ways. Great for teaching little ones the basics of counting, number recognition, and subitizing.
pros: Bright, colorful cards instantly capture attention
Gameplay is incredibly flexible and easily adjusted to suit varying skill levels
Can be used to teach a variety of skills, including counting, number identification, addition, subtraction, and much more
cons: We'd love it even more if the cards were laminated

customer_reviews.title: I love, love this product
customer_reviews.text: I teach in a Montessori style preschool. I love, love this product. I use the number cards to make sure that a child can identify the numbers and then that they can place the numbers in the correct order. Then I start with one set of the cards for a very young student. My more advanced students can use all the sets. The quality of the game is impressive. The cards are sturdy and well made. Each set of cards is bright and colorful making this work fun and interesting for the child. I plan to use this set for years to come. This is one of the best purchases I have bought for my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Gintex

customer_reviews.title: 3 isn't too young!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that my 3 yo might not be up for the game, but we just sat and played number games for almost 2 hours! Even clean-up can be a game (sorting by color and then putting numbers in order!). This is a really nice deck. Beautiful colors and good quality. Looking forward to years of math fun.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully Fun Teaching Games in One Box
customer_reviews.text: We love this game. Played with a child who is struggling in math a bit and he was immediately drawn to it and played it over and over again. I like the many different games you can play with this one box. I also think you can make up some of your own to suit your needs. I think this is a wonderful game that is also a teaching tool. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: momkl

customer_reviews.title: Portable and versatile game
customer_reviews.text: Love how many games you can play with these cards! I wanted something small we could bring on a trip and there are so many suggested games inside this little box. There are several decks of cards (0-10) with different patterns that seem to align with stuff my first grader knows from school, like ten-frames. My first grader's favorite is playing memory with two different decks - one is a ten-frame and one is polka dots. He has to try to find the ten frame that has the same number as the polka dot (dice) card. Fun for him and us grown ups!
customer_reviews.author: I&D

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these!! I use them with my students all the time. I recommend them to parents and coworker. There are so many different engaging and differentiated ways to use them! Dan has many more games on his website for these as well. But kids also make up some pretty great games all on their own with them. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: it's great that these cards have so many game variations to ...
customer_reviews.text: As a mom of a 6 and 3 year old, it's great that these cards have so many game variations to play with either child, at varying degrees of difficulty. I will be re-buying as a gift for friends.
customer_reviews.author: twhirl

customer_reviews.title: Great math game for kids!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 & 3 year old that I homeschool. We use this to help their math skills. So far have only played a few games but my youngest (boy) is ALL about numbers and stacking things. He likes to take the cards out and line up the numbers in order etc. I look forward to using the whole deck but right now about 3-4 of the decks suit our math levels. Very Very creative and stimulating without them realizing they are DOING MATH! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ranya

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Excellent game. Very versatile. There are fun, age appropriate math games to play with each of my kids (ages 4, 6, and 9). The cards are very sturdy and I would imagine that this game will last my family a long time.
customer_reviews.author: MPfamily

customer_reviews.title: Great for little learners!
customer_reviews.text: My son was completely against using these because he didn’t want to “learn” (his words, not mine). When I asked his older sister to play war with me using the cards he became very intrigued and wanted to play. We played several rounds even. These cards are well made and somewhat sturdy. I think we’ll keep these around! So far we’ve played memory and war but there are so many other options for play in this tiny little box. Great homeschool idea for those families that do :)
customer_reviews.author: B_stein8

customer_reviews.title: My daughter (3 1/2) loves playing with these cards, ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (3 1/2) loves playing with these cards, not even realizing that it's the math part of her home-schooling :) The including instructions provide enough game ideas to keep her on her toes and appropriately challenged for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The possibilities are endless!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fantastic, open-concept game. You can really get creative and use it in many ways. My 3 year old enjoys matching the numbers to the dot cards. We've really been exploring different ways of playing the game for his age level. I just wish the cards were thicker/better quality... especially when little hands are involved. I've seen deck of cards that are far better quality. That said, it's well worth it. It's a great game.
customer_reviews.author: S. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: What a terrific thinking game. Kids gain confidence doing mental math with an engaging family game. Works well for our preschooler and also our second grader- love that the kids are 4 years apart but every game has options to adjust to ability.
customer_reviews.author: EAP

customer_reviews.title: Important tool in early learning classrooms
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic resource for teachers or parents if young children. Subitizing practice in fun and playful ways. The cards are excellent quality and the game ideas are great, too. Every pre-k and K teacher needs these to use with kiddos that lack accurate counting skills. First graders making tons of errors with addition and subtraction? Go back and check their subitizing and counting strategies with this card set!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Cute and open-ended
customer_reviews.text: This is a unique way to get young children comfortable recognizing numbers in many different presentations. I currently use this set to play War with my four-year-old. It’s so much more fun than flash cards and more accessible at that age than playing cards.
customer_reviews.author: Marlee Bangerter

customer_reviews.title: No Roman Numerals
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for homeschool or classroom use, ages 3-8. The only thing I wish is that it had a set of the numbers in Roman numerals. I assumed that it did, since the quantities are portrayed in so many different ways. Alas, that is not one of them. That would be more helpful than the one where the dots are different colors (the red set), which is the most confusing set and the one we use the least.
customer_reviews.author: waldorf_curric

customer_reviews.title: Fun, travel friendly game
customer_reviews.text: Since it arrived my skeptical 5 year old has been hooked :) We have played some 3+ ones on bad mood days, some 5+ ones on normal tired evenings and 7+ ones on going on adventure mood days and all of them have been super fun and exciting. The good thing is the games are never boring as they keep changing. We can travel with it and play it anywhere. Great entertainment for the family.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful math concepts in a game, very entertaining
customer_reviews.text: I am a first grade teacher but also a mom of a 3 year old. For COVID at home I am using this with my 3 year old to teach her her numbers and she loves it! She is understanding and playing games. In the evening she plays with her Daddy and he can’t believe “how smart” she is! 😍 I love that this game is leveled and will grow with her up to adding and subtracting! What wonderful concepts.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: My 4 year old who hates board games loves this
customer_reviews.text: My very active 4 year old will not sit down to play card games or board games. But he loves this game. His favorite is "feed the numbers". Very age appropriate and a great way to sneak in a math lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Game!
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher this is such an awesome game to play with your kids to help expose them to number sense and number representation. Both my boys, almost 4 & 6 love to play and you can make it as “easy” or challenging as you’d like by simply modifying each game you play. I recently also purchased for my nephews 5th birthday as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Besagno

customer_reviews.title: So worth it.
customer_reviews.text: GET IT!! My newly 4 year old has shown little interest in any sort of board games or puzzles that look educational... he loved this as soon as we took it out of the box. For the age range and price I haven’t found a game I personally like more. It’s very well made and small enough to take along. Super happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jillyd83

customer_reviews.title: Must own game for littles
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute must have for not only homeschoolers but folks with younger kids who want to get into school with their older siblings. My five year old will play with this game on her own in various ways or we sit together and do one of the many games provided. We played the game “trash” with using three of the different types of cards and used zeros as the trash cards. She beat me three times. So fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great value! I love the multiple options for use so my 4 yr old son son doesn’t get bored and lost importantly he loves the cards/games as well. The only small critique I have is while cards are the average thickness and sturdiness of a standard deck of cards so they aren’t flimsy, I would have liked them to be a bit more reinforced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little math game
customer_reviews.text: This game was just what I needed for my preschooler during COVID. I will continue to use this as part of her kindergarten math. The box comes with directions on how to make the cards useful for a large age range, and various games to play. We enjoyed the memory style games, war and go fish.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: My 4 year old LOVES this
customer_reviews.text: This is super clever, fairly simple but the sets of cards make for flexible variety in the game play making it fun and new each time you play. My 4 year old passionate about numbers and counting this game exercises these skills without even focussing on Math only on having fun. Great little box!
customer_reviews.author: January

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 3 year old son and it was money well spent. It can be adapted into many games and for different ages. We have played the monster munch and memory. I've also recommended it to teachers at the school where I work, as it incorporates 10-frames.
customer_reviews.author: Erin L

customer_reviews.title: Developmentally appropriate but fun game!
customer_reviews.text: Really fun, versatile, but also very educational game. As an early childhood teacher, I really appreciate how developmentally appropriate this game is and how many variations it includes for different skill levels and ages. Would definitely recommend for use in classrooms or at home! It's a great way to "practice" math while maintaining a sense of joy and exploration.
customer_reviews.author: littlehannahd

customer_reviews.title: Educational & fun, WIN-WIN!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for my home pre k I do with my toddlers!! You make makeup side games also using the cards. I put the 5 card down, my 2 year old tells me the number then brings 5 ‘pink items’/‘items that have wheels’/etc. sky is the limit with these cards. Great find! Would buy for birthday gifts or baby shower gift as future use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Offers lots of games in one small box. Fun and educational. Compact. Smart. I also gave as a gift to a 5 year old; very well received.
customer_reviews.author: HEIDI from NYC

customer_reviews.title: Great for conceptualizing numbers!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing game for reviewing and introducing math concepts. Love the different presentations of the values! Helps really conceptualize the numbers for littles!!! As a mom and teacher, I approve!!
customer_reviews.author: Tassja

customer_reviews.title: 8 yr old didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old garndaughter loves math and per the review, I thought she would love this, but she did not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Win win win all around...They loved them
customer_reviews.text: They children loved this. There are many ways to execute these cards. The tiny box packs a lot of might (learning power that is). They didn’t want to stop, and I made up additional games, other than the many that are suggested. Win win win all around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and elegant, a must if you have a young one learning to count in the house!
customer_reviews.text: The whole family loves this game! One going into kindergarten that enjoys the (many!) different games you can play, and another that's just getting into numbers and counting...perfect for both and I enjoy playing along. Can't say that for a lot of learning games!
customer_reviews.author: Eric R. Rubeck

customer_reviews.title: Great for Early Math Development
customer_reviews.text: Instructions provided for many different games (easily adaptable to meet your needs) to play with these cards. Great for early math development - and fun. Recommended by our school’s math specialist.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great educational tool
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of uses for these cards. I use them as flash cards for my younger children, and it helps them with number recognition. My older ones enjoy the games. I absolutely love them, and my children learn a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: The best!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best game for learning number sense and building a love for math. Dan is the best and can’t wait for more games. I play with my 2 year old son as well as my math classes ranging from 4-6 grade. So versatile. I also use this as my gift for every birthday party I go to. All my nieces and nephews have this game and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great educational game; sturdy cards
customer_reviews.text: Easy game that clearly teachers number concepts. The cards are thick and sturdy; I actually wish they were a bit smaller though. Takes a lot of space when using even just 20 cards for a game of memory.
customer_reviews.author: karen musclow

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not so user friendly. Some might like it but for me it was just way to disorganized.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a huge hit with our nearly-five-year-old who is just starting to expand into preschool math. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Joel and Heather

customer_reviews.title: lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, so colorful and lots of fun to play with kids. You can follow the rules or.create your own rules to play. Very helpful to teach my 3.5yr to focus, count, and learn basic of math.
customer_reviews.author: wanshu

customer_reviews.title: If you buy one math game, buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE BEST math game purchase I have made for my tutoring business. It’s an extremely versatile set of cards that I can use with a wide range of ages. I LOVE MATH FOR LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: isabel

customer_reviews.title: A helpful learning tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is fabulous! I am homeschooling my babies, 1 with learning disabilities, & I have found these to be a super helpful tool!! Math can be inviting & fun & this helps young kids experience that!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Quick and versatile games to introduce number concepts to young learners
customer_reviews.text: Easy to understand directions. Quick and versatile games to introduce number concepts to young learners. Bought for my 3 year old and worth it just for the sturdiness and colors
customer_reviews.author: A. Nash

customer_reviews.title: Math card learning
customer_reviews.text: The different ways the numbers are laid out in each card is awesome. It really gets the child thinking about the different ways a number could be represented.
customer_reviews.author: Red D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent learning tool!
customer_reviews.text: We love love love this game! It is so perfect. We started out with the 3-5 year old games, my daughter just turned 5 and she had fun with all of them. They weren’t super challenging though so we moved onto the age 6 games and those are absolutely perfect for her right now. I love watching the wheels turn in her little mind!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel G.

customer_reviews.title: Fun Learning
customer_reviews.text: My 4- and 6 year-olds like these and they are definitely learning. The younger is learning to count and sort, and the older is learning quick addition strategies.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Great math game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great math games for children! My 4 year old and my 8 year old both enjoy it! Lots of different games and uses. Definitely a 'must have' math addition!!
customer_reviews.author: Jer H

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My three year old and I love this game. We have had it for a few months and play the simplest games for now. I have slowly added more cards. There are a lot of games included that will provide us with fun for years to come. Fantastic game. Can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Connolly

customer_reviews.title: This is a grow with you math game for 4yo to start all the way up through 8yr
customer_reviews.text: What a great deck with so many different games for your child to grow into. They can play with you or alone once they have master the skill. A nice game to have if you want to teach problem solving skills and math skills.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Espiritu

customer_reviews.title: All around quality product
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy box and cards for lasting quality. The concept IPOand design are genius. The kids love them .Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Nice game but the easy levels are too easy and boring for our 3 year old, and the harder ones are too hard. Hopefully will use it a bit later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eh. It is ok.
customer_reviews.text: We actually ended up returning this. It wasn’t anything special. The idea of it is better than the actual item.
customer_reviews.author: OValli

customer_reviews.title: So versatile and fun for all
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun way to play math games and build math skills. My 4 and 6 year old love it. I am now buying this as a birthday present for friends!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am a math teacher and this is a fantastic resource for ages 4 - 7.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Nord

customer_reviews.title: Must have for guided math!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these!!!! These are thick cards that are great for guided math! I love the variety of cards and the instructions for the games are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: MariaAngel White

customer_reviews.title: Great math game
customer_reviews.text: My 1st grade students love this game. It is great for small groups and can be flexible to adjust for different levels. It has 18 games to play with these cards. It helps them see math and strategize.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Austin

customer_reviews.title: fun in a small container
customer_reviews.text: The cards are high quality and there are so many ways to use them with pre-school and early elementary kids.
customer_reviews.author: S. Walter

customer_reviews.title: Great game for kids!
customer_reviews.text: This is great tool to teach your kids counting and basic math skills while having fun. Even my 3 year old enjoys trying to play with us although he’s still a bit young for this game. What’s great is the variety of games you can play while also tailoring the difficulty level desired. Really great tool to keep in the game cabinet and kids off screens for a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Livetoplay

customer_reviews.title: Great for math instruction
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my special education classroom. I like that you can use the same cards for different levels of play. Make it more challenging for my older kids.
customer_reviews.author: Erma M. Rutter

customer_reviews.title: Ita good.
customer_reviews.text: We like it. It's a bit confusing about the rules but we got the hang of it. My daughter likes to play it most of the time til she gets frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: lamb

customer_reviews.title: ... any game or tool that builds early number sense better than this wonderful set of cards
customer_reviews.text: I don't know of any game or tool that builds early number sense better than this wonderful set of cards. And the great thing about them is that it's not just one game in a box but many many games. I have fun coming up with new games all the time. Tiny Polka Dot is a must-have for any early elementary school classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Math teacher

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect game ideas to help with number sense and subitizing. If they were less expensive, I would buy 14 more boxes. Great for a classroom center.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great game options. 4 year old can play. I love these. I’d buy again. I’d gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M

customer_reviews.title: These make learning fun
customer_reviews.text: I thought this might be too educational to be fun, but my three year old loves it all the way up to my seven year old and there are varying levels of cards that makes it fun.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A.

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommend this for your kids
customer_reviews.text: 100% recommend this for your kids!!! I started using it with my son when he was 2. He loves it and understands the concepts really well. GET THIS
customer_reviews.author: M. Rushbrook

customer_reviews.title: amazing game
customer_reviews.text: This tiny little game has so much in it that I will use with my class. I cannot wait to use it with them.
customer_reviews.author: J kahl

customer_reviews.title: My toddler loves this
customer_reviews.text: My 4-year old has only played the matching dots game so far but she really likes it. Purchased another set for my niece. I like how the games increase in complexity so there are many different ways to play.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great for ages 4-37!
customer_reviews.text: Entertaining for all ages. I played the simpler games with my 4 year old, the Intermediate games with my 8 year old and the hard pyramid games with my 24 year old nephew and 19 year old niece. The pyramid games challenged us for a good competition. I love that you can choose the game based on skill level and age.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Good learning product
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my great-niece. She is very interested in it and it is helping her to learn math.
customer_reviews.author: Craftergalore

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for my kinders!
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome! It works for at home practice or at school as a short time filler or math station.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: A Classroom Hit!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this game for my classroom. It has been a hit with my students. There are so many fun variations and it really engages my students. This is a must have for every K-2 classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for homeschooling!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool for homeschooling and overall teaching a love for numbers. The box is small which makes it easy to take along with you. There are also many games or ways to use this.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to find love to math
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old was struggling with math in kindergarten so I tought about new and fun way to help him and I found this game. He has been into it and even my 3 year old loves to play it as well
customer_reviews.author: janeth herrera

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this so many different games in one tiny box
customer_reviews.author: Christina D'Alessandro

customer_reviews.title: Confusing to me
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand all the games, would like better directions.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Manuel Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Nice game!
customer_reviews.text: Nice game and my kid likes so much. Would recommend my friends for them.
customer_reviews.author: R X.

customer_reviews.title: Great learning game.
customer_reviews.text: I use this game to teach my grandchildren how to count and order numbers correctly. It fun to use and they are learning while having fun!!!
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Game for Many Ages
customer_reviews.text: This game is great, especially for young kids! It is adaptable for many different age groups and I love the visual/spatial reasoning! I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Yoga Girl

customer_reviews.title: Fun + Easy way to practice math!
customer_reviews.text: This game is versatile for a wide age range and a fun way to practive math!
customer_reviews.author: Jim/Aimee Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: I have this game in my preschool classroom, the children have loved playing the different games. I bought one for my 4 year old granddaughter. She and her math dad had fun playing different games. Well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Trasi R. Fugate

customer_reviews.title: I started with simple games in Pre-Kindergarten - was a great way to introduce addition without teaching addition
customer_reviews.text: Multiple games can be played, with varying complexity. I started with simple games in Pre-Kindergarten - was a great way to introduce addition without teaching addition.
customer_reviews.author: R Lessler

customer_reviews.title: Teacher's pet
customer_reviews.text: I use these cards for math inteventio, particularly for kindergarten. There are so many concepts I can cover with them!
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Williams-Tomhave

customer_reviews.title: Learning made fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome! My daughter loves how the cards can be used to play multiple different games, all of which have her excited to do math. She has even taught the games to her younger brother and to adults.
customer_reviews.author: April M. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: nice and colorful
customer_reviews.text: use these with my 4 year old he loves them
customer_reviews.author: Amanda03x

customer_reviews.title: Many choices for use
customer_reviews.text: Great find for me. Lots of uses in my classroom
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Crandal

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is an AWESOME way to introduce numeracy and basic math concepts. As a first grade teacher, I highly recommend! And bonus - my 4 year old enjoys this “game”!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Study math cards and great multi-level games.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 4k class as well as my 7 year old grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Crys

customer_reviews.title: A fabulous gift
customer_reviews.text: Perfect game for the budding mathematicians in your life! Encourages problem solving, critical thinking, creativity... love!
customer_reviews.author: shoppingcec49

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Great game for learning numbers. 3-4 yr old preschoolers loved it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Now on to my 3rd daughter using, STILL discovering new ways to use this game. As an educator, I see the value of introducing things like this to kids at a young age. They love it and so do Mom and Dad!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Esch

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These cards are great. We have used them a ton for matching and subitizing. Great quality and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: aMom

customer_reviews.title: Great learning game for preschool kids
customer_reviews.text: I love this game! I bought it for my preschooler and she loves to play with it! So fun and reinforces understanding how to count! It is great!
customer_reviews.author: MommyKC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 2 and 5 year olds!
customer_reviews.text: Great game that can easily be adapted to different ages!
customer_reviews.author: Lorubo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for math games
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old and 3 year old love these games. There are plenty of game options that can scale up or down. The cards are durable and the perfect size for kids’ hands.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Thacker

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and great idea
customer_reviews.text: My twin boys are only two years old, but they already love playing with these cards. They can only really match number of dots and the number, but it’s a start. They get excited every time we pull out the box.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great option to learn basic math skills starting around age 3
customer_reviews.text: Good quality cards. Geat directions for multiple game options based on age. Very well put together.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great ratings can be believed
customer_reviews.text: I happened upon this game, while looking for something else. The ratings and price encouraged me to buy it for a friend's 3-year old. I heard just recently that he loves it and everyone plays it with him.
customer_reviews.author: Julius Z.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family as your little ones learns!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter in preparation for homeschooling. She’s only 4, but this game has already done so much. The games are pretty fun and allow for the whole family to join in and help your little one as they learn.
customer_reviews.author: TNO

customer_reviews.title: Great math concepts for ages 3-7!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game for teaching preschool - primary kids math/number sense!
customer_reviews.author: Erin K -Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to using this only classroom
customer_reviews.text: Really cool game & it’s great for a wide age range.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen A.

customer_reviews.title: Good math game
customer_reviews.text: Good purchase. Would buy again. It’s good for building number sense and both kids (4 and 8) like to play!
customer_reviews.author: reader

product_meta.title: Math for Love Tiny Polka Dot
product_meta.description: Color:Original VersionIntroducing Tiny Polka Dot, the colorful card deck that grows with your child. With 16 easy-to-learn games that playfully teach math, from counting & early numeracy to arithmetic & logic, Tiny Polka Dot is the perfect way to nurture your child's love of math: through play! Mathematician-designed and teacher-approved, Tiny Polka Dot is the playful way to fall in love with numbers. Made in the USA. Recommended Age: 3 - 8+ Players: 1 - 6 Time: 5 - 15 minutes. Winner of the "Brain Child" award from Tilliwig Toy and Media Awards, the Creative Child Game of the Year and the coveted National Parenting Center Seal of Approval!
feature_bullets: Sixteen easy-to-learn games help kids fall in love with numbers!
Playfully teaches counting, arithmetic, and logic
Easy to adapt for any child
Quality guarentee - if defective in any way, contact manufacturer
